If you don't remember doing such action, you may be victim of a scammer. Scammer might be:
Someone remote who managed to get your user credentials.
Someone who had physical access to your machine as you were still logged.

Most common scam schemes are:
Changing the footer of your document layout to invite your customers to pay invoices on a scam bank account.
Changing the bank account(s) of the company (same purpose).
Changing the bank account(s) of your vendors, so that you pay your bills on a scam bank account.
Changing the email address of a user.
You will receive warning mails like this one every time one of those actions is performed, to prevent scammers from going under the radar.

Take security measures (change password, lock screen when away...) to avoid this issue in the future.

Verify no sales invoices were sent between and now. Contact your customers if necessary.
